channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SC

item.title: Report E-2023081000
item.description:
Report E-2023081000

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: WEST COLUMBIA
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 18, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1903 was punctured by a nail and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the concrete floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from 3R Incorporated (3R) to remediate the impacted site. Crews patched and collected the damaged 55-gallon drum and placed it in a 95-gallon over-pack drum for disposal. Crews utilized a pump up sprayer and absorbent pads to remove any residual product from the concrete floor. All quaternary ammonia compound impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 95-gallon drum and were added to RLC waste stream for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080837
item.description:
Report E-2023080837

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: ROCK HILL
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 11, 2023, at 1018 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Rock Hill, South Carolina regarding the release of approximately (10) gallons of H834-RAA-30 (Resin Solution, UN1866, 3, III) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The release was reportedly due to a punctured drum during load shift. Contractors were dispatched and upon arrival, they confirmed that the release was contained to wooden pallets and the trailer floor. The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DF, and (3) 95-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023080791
item.description:
Report X-2023080791

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: FORT MILL
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING IN UNLOAD. THE DIAMOND LABEL INDICATED THAT IT WAS A CORROSIVE AND SHOULD BE HANDLED WITH CARE, SO I TOOK OUT THE BOTTLES OF CLEANER AND PLACED THEM IN A LINED DRUM. THE BOX WAS WET FROM THE LIQUID SO I PLACED IT IN THE DRUM AS WELL. DescribePack: PACKAGE FAILURE WAS ON THE LIDS OF THE GALLON BOTTLES OF CLEANER. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE BOTTLES WERE TIGHTENED, PLACED IN A HAZ BAG, AND THEN IN A DRUM.
